recipes.name: Grilled Steak
recipes.instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients required for grilled steak, ensuring vegetables are chopped, proteins are trimmed, and seasonings are measured.
2. Prepare Beef steak by cleaning, cutting, trimming, or seasoning it depending on the traditional method for this dish.
3. Heat a skillet, pan, pot, or oven to the appropriate temperature specified for the dish, ensuring it is preheated properly.
4. Add oil, butter, or fat to the cooking vessel and allow it to heat until shimmering or melted.
5. Add aromatics such as onions, garlic, herbs, or spices and sauté until fragrant and lightly browned.
6. Add the primary ingredient and cook it using the appropriate technique—such as searing, roasting, simmering, or frying—until it develops color.
7. Incorporate secondary ingredients like vegetables, broths, wines, sauces, or pastes and mix thoroughly.
8. Adjust heat to medium or low and allow the dish to cook slowly so flavors blend and the main ingredient cooks fully.
9. Stir occasionally, deglaze with wine or stock if needed, and ensure nothing sticks to the bottom of the pan.
10. Taste the dish and adjust seasoning by adding salt, pepper, herbs, or acidity such as lemon or vinegar.
11. When everything is cooked to ideal tenderness and consistency, remove from heat and allow it to rest briefly.
12. Plate the dish attractively and garnish with herbs, sauces, or toppings traditionally served with this recipe.

7. Incorporate secondary ingredients like vegetables, broths, wines, sauces, or pastes and mix thoroughly.
8. Adjust heat to medium or low and allow the dish to cook slowly so flavors blend and the main ingredient cooks fully.
9. Stir occasionally, deglaze with wine or stock if needed, and ensure nothing sticks to the bottom of the pan.
10. Taste the dish and adjust seasoning by adding salt, pepper, herbs, or acidity such as lemon or vinegar.
11. When everything is cooked to ideal tenderness and consistency, remove from heat and allow it to rest briefly.
12. Plate the dish attractively and garnish with herbs, sauces, or toppings traditionally served with this recipe.
